headline.main: For Elderly, Thinner Isn't Better, Researchers Say

docs.lead_paragraph: Being slightly overweight poses little risk for men and women over 70, a study has found, but being thinner than normal can be dangerous. Using a formula based on height and weight, researchers found the risk of mortality to be high in elderly people who are underweight, rising sharply the leaner they were.
